Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2012 08:27AM SMNJ07 wrote: Thank you very much for your answers cinnamonsmiles and beesie.  I called and left a message requesting a copy of my report, emphasizing that I had to call for the results and I wanted someone to call me back to explain to me what "benign ductal cells" actually mean - were there abnormal cells or fatty tissue.  I guess it's possible that's what the pathology report had in the first report on the other lump, but the doctor didn't describe it that way, just that the biopsy didn't find anything.  His assistant said "you're fine, the report says there were benign ductal cells".  I was at work and when I called they had to pull my file and and she reviewed the report before getting on line with me.  I know that I kind of froze when she read that and my mind was going a mile a minute.  The more I think about it, the more angry I'm getting.
Posts.Title: Benign Ductal Cells SMNJ07 SMNJ07

Posts.Content: SMNJ07 wrote: Hello everyone!  New to this board.  I've just received the results back on a breast biopsy I had on a lump I found at 10 o'clock on my right breast.  I actually had to call them because it had been 2 weeks to the day and no phone call, but my doctor's assistant told me that the results came back as "benign ductal cells".  What is that?  Did they find cells that looked abnormal in the ducts but were benign?  I had another biopsy in the same breast a year before, located higher and closer to the chest wall and those results I received within a few days.  The Doctor said that I had fibrocystic breasts but wanted me to come back to see him the following year (this year) after my annuals.  Now I just had a bilateral diagnostic mammo on this breast with ultrasound with nothing looking out of the ordinary, like last year and I have a different outcome.  Can someone explain to me what this means and may mean in the future?  Thank you!  Steph Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Benign Ductal Cells SMNJ07 SMNJ07

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2012 08:43AM SMNJ07 wrote: Thank you farmerlucydaisy.  I have to learn that it is okay to request copies of these reports automatically.
Posts.Title: Benign Ductal Cells SMNJ07 SMNJ07

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2012 05:36PM SMNJ07 wrote: Thanks again everyone! For an update, I getting the results mailed to me and I did get the assistant on the phone again and I explained to her that I've never had a result described to me like that before, so I didn't know if there were extra cells or abnormal cells found, etc.  The last time I was just told that I had fibrocystic breasts and nothing was found.  She said that all it meant was that the sample was made up of ductal cells and not lobular cells and some bloody cells.  The cells from the sample were benign.  She read the results directly from the report and in a way, I think that I would rather have that type of description and not a general "everything came back normal..."  I'd rather know exactly what it is that was tested, how and why.  I guess the best advice is to make sure that you truly understand what the results are saying and if you have questions don't be afraid to ask and get a copy of the pathology report
Posts.Title: Benign Ductal Cells SMNJ07 SMNJ07
